1.name: Breakfast at Tiffany's
1.description: A young New York socialite becomes interested in a young man who has moved into her apartment building, but her past threatens to get in the way.

2.name: West Side Story
2.description: Two youngsters from rival New York City gangs fall in love, but tensions between their respective friends build toward tragedy.

3.name: One Hundred and One Dalmatians
3.description: When a litter of Dalmatian puppies are abducted by the minions of Cruella de Vil, the parents must find them before she uses them for a diabolical fashion statement.

4.name: The Parent Trap
4.description: Teenage twin sisters swap places and scheme to reunite their divorced parents.

5.name: Judgment at Nuremberg
5.description: In 1948, an American court in occupied Germany tries four Nazis judged for war crimes.

6.name: The Hustler
6.description: An up-and-coming pool player plays a long-time champion in a single high-stakes match.

7.name: The Misfits
7.description: A divorcée falls for an over-the-hill cowboy who is struggling to maintain his romantically independent lifestyle.

8.name: Paris Blues
8.description: During the 1960s, two American expatriate jazz musicians living in Paris meet and fall in love with two American tourist girls.

9.name: The Guns of Navarone
9.description: A British team is sent to cross occupied Greek territory and destroy the massive German gun emplacement that commands a key sea channel.

10.name: Yôjinbô
10.description: A crafty ronin comes to a town divided by two criminal gangs and decides to play them against each other to free the town.

11.name: The Innocents
11.description: A young governess for two children becomes convinced that the house and grounds are haunted.

12.name: The Comancheros
12.description: Texas Ranger Jake Cutter arrests gambler Paul Regret, but soon finds himself teamed with his prisoner in an undercover effort to defeat a band of renegade arms merchants and thieves known as Comancheros.

13.name: Mr. Sardonicus
13.description: A search for a winning lottery ticket in his dead father's grave causes Sardonicus' face to freeze in a horrible grimace, until he forces a doctor to treat his affliction--with even more ...                See full summary »

14.name: Splendor in the Grass
14.description: A fragile Kansas girl's love for a handsome young man from the town's most powerful family drives her to heartbreak and madness.

15.name: One-Eyed Jacks
15.description: After robbing a Mexican bank, Dad Longworth takes the loot and leaves his partner Rio to be captured but Rio escapes and searches for Dad in California.

16.name: El Cid
16.description: The fabled Spanish hero Rodrigo Diaz de Bivar (a.k.a. El Cid) (Charlton Heston) overcomes a family vendetta and court intrigue to defend Christian Spain against the Moors.

17.name: Pit and the Pendulum
17.description: In the sixteenth century, Francis Barnard travels to Spain to clarify the strange circumstances of his sister's death after she had married the son of a cruel Spanish Inquisitor.

18.name: One, Two, Three
18.description: In West Berlin during the Cold War, a Coca-Cola executive is given the task of taking care of his boss' socialite daughter.

19.name: The Children's Hour
19.description: A troublemaking student at a girls' school accuses two teachers of being lesbians.

20.name: La notte
20.description: A day in the life of an unfaithful married couple and their steadily deteriorating relationship.

21.name: Blue Hawaii
21.description: After arriving back in Hawaii from the Army, Chad Gates defies his parents' wishes for him to work at the family business and instead goes to work as a tour guide at his girlfriend's agency.

22.name: L'année dernière à Marienbad
22.description: In a strange and isolated chateau, a man becomes acquainted with a woman and insists that they have met before.

23.name: Mosura
23.description: A giant, ancient moth begins to attack Japan when coming to the rescue of its two, foot-tall worshippers who were taken by shipwreck survivors.

24.name: The Curse of the Werewolf
24.description: In 18th Century Spain, an adopted boy becomes a werewolf and terrorizes the inhabitants of his town.

25.name: Mysterious Island
25.description: During the Civil War a group of Union soldiers and two Confederates escape the stockade using a hot air balloon and end up on a strange Pacific island.

26.name: Master of the World
26.description: In 1868, an American scientist and his team become hostages of fanatical pacifist Robur who uses his airship Albatross to destroy military targets on Earth.

27.name: Flower Drum Song
27.description: A young woman arrives in San Francisco's Chinatown from Hong Kong with the intention of marrying a rakish nightclub owner, unaware he is involved with one of his singers.

28.name: Viridiana
28.description: Viridiana, a young nun about to take her final vows, pays a visit to her widowed uncle at the request of her Mother Superior.

29.name: A Taste of Honey
29.description: A pregnant teenage girl must fend for herself when her mother remarries, leaving the girl with only a new male friend for support.

30.name: Såsom i en spegel
30.description: Recently released from a mental hospital; Karin rejoins her emotionally disconnected family and their island home, only to slip from reality as she begins to believe she is being visited by God.

31.name: Lover Come Back
31.description: A series of misunderstandings leaves an advertising executive with a campaign for a product which has not yet been invented, while he romances his rival in the guise of its inventor.

32.name: A Raisin in the Sun
32.description: A substantial insurance payment could mean either financial salvation or personal ruin for a poor black family.

33.name: King of Kings
33.description: The temporary physical life of the Biblical Savior, Jesus Christ.

34.name: Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea
34.description: When the Earth is threatened by a burning Van Allen Radiation Belt, U.S. Navy Admiral Harriman Nelson plans to shoot a nuclear missile at the Belt, using his experimental atomic submarine, the Seaview.

35.name: Une femme est une femme
35.description: A French striptease artist is desperate to become a mother. When her reluctant boyfriend suggests that his best friend impregnate her, feelings become complicated when she accepts.

36.name: Pocketful of Miracles
36.description: A New York gangster and his girlfriend attempt to turn street beggar Apple Annie into a society lady when the peddler learns her daughter is marrying royalty.

37.name: The Day the Earth Caught Fire
37.description: When the U.S. and Russia unwittingly test atomic bombs at the same time, it alters the nutation (axis of rotation) of the Earth.

38.name: Divorzio all'italiana
38.description: A married Sicilian baron falls in love with his cousin and vows to wed her, but with divorce illegal he must concoct a crime of passion to do away with his wife.

39.name: The Ladies Man
39.description: A clueless, recently single graduate unwittingly takes a job as a servant in a mansion inhabited by dozens of young women.

40.name: Il colosso di Rodi
40.description: While on holiday in Rhodes, Athenian war hero Darios becomes involved in two different plots to overthrow the tyrannical king, one from Rhodian patriots and the other from sinister Phoenician agents.

41.name: Come September
41.description: Younger generation vs. "older" folks on vacation at an Italian villa.

42.name: Taste of Fear
42.description: A wheelchair-bound young woman returns to her father's estate after ten years, and although she's told he's away, she keeps seeing his dead body on the estate.

43.name: The Roman Spring of Mrs. Stone
43.description: An aging actress travels to Rome with her husband; after he suddenly dies during the flight, she begins a passionate affair with a young gigolo.

44.name: The Absent Minded Professor
44.description: A college professor invents an anti-gravity substance which a corrupt businessman wants for himself.

45.name: Murder She Said
45.description: When Miss Marple reports witnessing a murder through the window of a passing train, the police dismiss her as a dotty spinster when no trace of the crime can be found.

46.name: Accattone
46.description: A pimp with no other means to provide for himself finds his life spiraling out of control when his prostitute is sent to prison.

47.name: Barabbas
47.description: Barabbas, the criminal that Pontius Pilate induced the populace to vote to set free, so that Christ could be crucified, is haunted by the image of Jesus for the rest of his life.

48.name: Town Without Pity
48.description: Four American soldiers stationed near a German village face death in the rape of a local girl, and are defended by outside counsel Major Steve Garrett.

49.name: Two Rode Together
49.description: A corrupt marshal is pressured by his army friend into negotiating the release of white captives of the Comanches, but finds that their reintegration into society has its consequences.

50.name: Homicidal
50.description: The brutal stabbing murder of a justice-of-the-peace sparks an investigation of dark family secrets in a sleepy small town in Southern California.
